yes, it is a driver for the wireless card in my laptop
you have two options. can you currently access your windows partition from ubuntu?
no, I don't think I can
it isn't displayed on my ubuntu desktop so I dont think I can
ok. well like peepsalot said, you can access your ext3 filesystem from windows by installing a program that you can download from http://www.fs-driver.org. install that program under windows.
but you said you were trying to install a wifi driver for windows right? then you probably can't download anything from fs-driver.org.
it says that is for ext2 filesystems, will it still work on my ext3?
yes. ext3 is identical to ext2 except that it has what's known as a journal, which ensures that writing to the disk is safe even if it is interrupted part-way through.
the other option is to mount your windows partition under linux.
so that program is executed in windows?
i'll give it a try, thanks for your help

After you install the program from www.fs-driver.org. You can mount your linux partition under windows. That is, you will be able to access all the files on your GNU/Linux partition from My Computer under Windows (there will be another drive there, such as H: drive or something). So if you saved the desired files in some part of your Linux partition, you can access that file through a drive in My Computer in Windows. Optional
